title: Food Stamp Cuts Expose Trump’s Strategy to Use Shutdown to Advance Agenda
summary: The president has stretched the limits of his powers to help those at the heart of his agenda, not the many in greatest need.

title: For SNAP Recipients, Anxiety Over Funding Leads to Hard Choices
summary: At one grocery store in Massachusetts, SNAP recipients faced growing fears, dwindling funds and lighter shopping carts.

title: Trump Administration Must Make Food Stamp Payments Within Days, Judge Says
summary: The written order came one day after a court told the Trump administration it must pay benefits in the program known as SNAP during the shutdown.

title: Even for Some Mamdani Supporters, His Thin Résumé Is Cause for Concern
summary: Many voters struggle with a fundamental question about Zohran Mamdani’s candidacy: Is a 34-year-old state assemblyman ready to lead the nation’s largest city?

title: In Chinese American Families, There’s a Generational Split on Mamdani
summary: Many older Chinese immigrants are shifting to the political right, dividing from their children, a trend playing out in the New York City mayor’s race.

title: Andrew Cuomo, Scraping and Scrambling, Is Still Running as Andrew Cuomo
summary: The former governor, a distant second in most polls of the New York City mayor’s race, is working harder to attract voters and remind them who he is.

title: Trump’s Retribution Campaign Leaves D.C. Prosecutor’s Office in Crisis
summary: Few places have felt the effects as palpably as the U.S. attorney’s office in Washington, which is deeply enmeshed in the workings of government and has filed criminal cases against President Trump.

title: War Powers Law Does Not Apply to Trump’s Boat Strikes, Administration Says
summary: The move deepened the idea that a Vietnam-era law, which says congressionally unauthorized deployments into “hostilities” must end after 60 days, does not apply to airstrike campaigns.

title: Will Trump’s Tariff Deal Tilt the Playing Field Back Toward China?
summary: The president’s trade truce with China has lowered U.S. tariffs to a level that could pause a longer-term effort to reduce America’s dependence on Beijing.

title: Builders Find Hardship in Trump’s Tariffs And Deportations
summary: Material costs are rising, workers are scarce and customers are delaying new construction plans.

title: How to Track Runners in the NYC Marathon
summary: Spectators can use an app to track runners in real time on race day.

title: The Woman Who Wouldn’t Stop Having Children
summary: MaryBeth Lewis had 13 kids, but she wanted more. Her desire to be a new mom again at 65 led to felony charges — and a custody battle like no other.

title: In a Dark Year, Los Angeles Basks in the Dodgers’ Glow
summary: Scars of wildfires and immigration raids won’t soon fade, but like the city itself, the Dodgers persevered and gave Southern California residents the rally they needed.

title: Canadians Mourn a Loss by Underdogs Who Brought a Nation Together
summary: The Blue Jays, Canada’s only M.L.B. team, were a salve for a country hit by President Trump’s threats and tariffs. Then the Dodgers ended their thrilling postseason run.

title: This Is the Way You Beat Trump — and Trumpism
summary: Democrats do not just need to win more people. They also need to win more places.

title: Why Trump Can Do No Wrong
summary: If there is no cover-up, then there must not have been a crime.

title: Communities in Hurricane-Ravaged Jamaica Still Cut Off as Death Toll Climbs
summary: The authorities have yet to reach dozens of areas in Jamaica, raising the question of how many people really died in last week’s storm.

title: Cleaning Bones for Day of the Dead
summary: Practitioners of an annual ritual to clean deceased relatives’ bones are grappling with a new challenge: tourists. Jack Nicas, our Mexico City bureau chief, visits Pomuch, a town in Eastern Mexico that celebrates Día de Muertos unlike any other place.

title: To Celebrate Day of the Dead, One Mexican Town Digs Up Its Dead
summary: Pomuch, Mexico, is one of the last places where residents clean their relatives’ bones. Now they are grappling with a new challenge: tourists.

title: 2 Arrested After Stabbing on Train Near Cambridge, England
summary: Prime Minister Keir Starmer of Britain denounced the attack, which the police said left nine victims with “life-threatening injuries.”
